name: Italian Game
ideas: Develop quickly, target f7, build a strong center. White aims for an early d4 break.

name: Ruy Lopez
ideas: Pressure e5 indirectly via Nc6. White builds a slow positional squeeze with c3 and d4.

name: Sicilian Najdorf
ideas: Black fights for queenside counterplay and avoids symmetry. Sharp, tactical middlegames.

name: Sicilian Dragon
ideas: Fianchetto the bishop to g7, pressure the long diagonal. Often leads to opposite-side castling attacks.

name: French Defense
ideas: Solid but slightly cramped. Black aims to undermine White's center with ...c5. The light-squared bishop is a known challenge.

name: Caro-Kann Defense
ideas: Similar to the French but keeps the light-squared bishop active. Solid, low-risk structure for Black.

name: Queen's Gambit Declined
ideas: Black holds the center solidly with ...e6. A classical approach leading to strategic maneuvering.

name: King's Indian Defense
ideas: Black allows White a big center, then counterattacks with ...e5 or ...c5. Dynamic and combative.

name: Nimzo-Indian Defense
ideas: Pin the knight on c3 to control e4. Flexible structure, Black can play for central or flank pressure.

name: English Opening
ideas: Flexible flank opening. White controls d5 without committing the d-pawn. Can transpose into many systems.

name: Scotch Game
ideas: Immediate central break. Open game with quick development. White trades a central pawn for rapid piece play.

name: Pirc Defense
ideas: Hypermodern: let White build a big center, then undermine it. The fianchettoed bishop eyes d4.
